I think it works like a shuffled deck

I'm going to try and respond to a couple of themes here in the thread:

1. The voting is in random order so that means you may see some duplicates, but random order helps ensue that we are getting even coverage of voting across all the entries.

2. The community voting is not the final decision because the community will pick their favorites, but we need to make sure any winners followed the rules in full. You will see entires that do not meet all the rules because it's easier to eliminate entires at the end than before voting. The exception to this is entries that did not fit the content rating required of the contest.

3. When you submitted your entry you should have gotten a link to your submission, but if you are unable to find it, please submit a ticket to player support and we can find it for you.

**1.** i'm sorry but that is simply just not true. we are not seeing duplicates because it's in a random order, we are seeing someone submit their image more than once. there is an order to this and i had to click on so many pages to get as far back to find my gf's submissions, because she submitted them early and they were ALL in the order she submitted them in. meaning those in the first pages are the ones that were generally submitted LAST. which is completely unfair and not randomised at all..

**2. **So all you guys are doing is double checking that it's not something inappropriate/against the rules? Basically just rule checking and not 'solely judging' the art pieces like you said you would. In essence, the community voting is practically a final decision and the artists with more social media followers and those that submitted late are going to be more recognised than those that submitted early and not much social media following.

**3.** you didn't tell the artist to save that link at all, there was NO indication for ANYBODY that this contest would be like this. It was said that this contest would be **solely** judged by riot. Random LoL fanbase is not riot. 

**extremely disappointing. **
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Okay so almost everything you just said is completely wrong. You really need to do more research or at least read before you go ranting. 

1. These submissions are in random order because I've seen _my_ girlfriends on the first page, last page, a few times around the middle, etc. I've also seen multiple pictures from the same artist spread around in different orders even though they submitted them all at once.

2. Did you even read the contest? Here, I'll quote the day one post they made. 

"**JUDGING 
**
For the first round the _**community**_ will be the judge, working in Woobox to pick their favorites. Once y’all have voted, Riot Games will comb through your favorites and pick the winners.

**Clarity**

We need to know who your champ is and what their emotion is immediately

**Intensity**

Your champ isn’t just mad, they’re enraged, not just sad, they’re devastated  "

If you want a link, here. http://www.surrenderat20.net/2018/07/red-post-collection-series-3-merch.html

3. Use common sense? You were a sent a link to your drawing. Why would you not save it? I guarantee you anyone that actually cared saved that link. Your fault for losing it. {{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}

What a snobby reply.
Regardless if they're randomized or not(which they hardly are, going by a large amount of people complaining about it) you have to admit this format is completely and utterly useless for such a vast amount of entries. There are over 100+ pages to go through and Riot sincerely expects fair voting for entries? It's absurd, to say the least. It will blatantly end up being a popularity contest because no one besides people who care for art or feel sorry for the people getting the short end of the stick will vote sincerely using the site. People are relying on making threads/social media posts to boost their votes up because "woobox" has a terrible set up for such a contest, ultimately leading up to this being a popularity contest instead of people just genuinely voting for entries.
It's poor taste to set up a contest and have fans wade through dozens of entries FOR Riot, especially with how badly spread out the entries are. Only 21 entries per page in a contest that was globally promoted? And you expect people to just go through most or all of them? You sincerely can't expect this fanbase to sift through entries for Riot just so they can cherry pick at the end of it all. It's unfair to almost everyone who entered. Especially since the community itself are the ones who are policing the entries and not Riot/Woobox.
And as for the link? It isn't common sense to save a randomly thrown out link. There was no indication that the link was needed. All the confirmation page showed was that the entry was submitted and a random link next to it, that ultimately lead to nothing at the time if you actually went to said link. The website itself doesn't even have accounts that people could use to save their submissions in or grab from later on. It isn't a sign of caring enough or not to hold on to a random link that did nothing at the time and had no signs of doing anything for future events because there was no clear indication of so.
All in all, the idea of this contest was in the right area. But the execution? Poor and seems a bit rushed on Riot's end.
{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

In previous art contests when Riot was the sole judge people complained that there were more deserving entries that didn't make even the honorable mentions list so Riot opened the next contest to voting. The complaint they ran into after that was as you loaded more entries onto the page it got really laggy, which is why I think they limited it to 21 entries per page. Now the complaint is that we have to flip through a lot of pages and that it's a popularity contest. While I understand the complaints and I think the execution was poor, I'm starting to feel like there's no winning in terms of format.

Probably because he didn't really follow the rules. It's not an emote contest. It's an "extreme" emotion contest. Rage, Despair, etc. All he did was take Riot's own emote idea (which makes what he did not orignal, another rule), and make his own emotes that don't even show extreme emotion in them. Half of the entries I've seen are getting disqualified just because people didn't actually read the rules of the contest Riot made.

As excited as I was for this contest, the thing that kind of sucks is the system used for submitting entries. I have never heard of Woobox up til now, but some feedback on the service is that they need to have an account or entry system in order to cut down on repeat drawings. I feel bad because I had to enter mine about 3-4 times because the preview showed it as cropped in the wrong way, but in reality it was fine the whole time. There was no system in place to edit or delete screw ups, and that took away from the entire process.

I also resubmitted one of mine a few times because the preview showed it as cropped and I noticed a comment from Riot's Support to try again to be safe. I assumed they would just remove the extra ones. :/ I'm super sad about the system they chose to do this with and how unorganized it is.
